description: This course investigates how modernity has construed the relationship between "history" and "religion," and how many cultures practice the two in tandem. We will take special notice of how these two cultural areas interact in South Asia. Themes addressed include debates about the role of memory, suffering, and death in historiography; how histories are gendered; and the possibiities of oral and performative historiographies.
